title: rerun: do not delete parent directories of outputs if those are otherwise empty

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
#### What is the problem?
`datalad rerun` deletes parent directories of outputs if those are otherwise empty, resulting in failing scripts if a parent directory is not explicitly created.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Create a script that produces some output, e.g. `code/produce-output.sh`:
```
#!/bin/sh

echo "test" > outputs/output1.txt
echo "test2" > outputs/output2.txt
```
Create the `outputs` directory, then run the script:
```
datalad run --output "outputs/*.txt" "code/produce-output.sh"
```
At this point a rerun works fine.

If we now clone the repository so that the outputs are not in the local annex, a rerun deletes the `*.txt` symlinks as well as the parent directory `outputs/`, which leads to a failing script as it does not create the directory itself. As soon as at least one of the outputs is in the local annex, so e.g. after a `datalad get outputs/output1.txt`, the rerun works again.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
Version 0.14.0 on Linux (NixOS) installed through conda

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
I am not sure if this might even be intended behaviour, but as a naive user I would assume prior `datalad get`'s to not have an influence on the outcome of reruns.
